column4: when I list partitions with fdisk -l I seem to miss one SATA HDD I recently put in the machine.. I assume I can't see it because the motherboard doesn't see it ?
you have to tell fdisk which device to look at
e.g. fdisk -l /dev/sdb
well by fdisk -l he listed what seems to be all that he can, he listed /dev/sda1 /dev/sdb1 /dev/sdb2 etc
ok
so I see no reason for it to miss a whole disk unless it doesn't see it
oops, i was looking at the manpage for the bsd fdisk
if it's not in the dmesg output, it'll probably be in the bootup messages in the syslog
I'll have to google that, it's probably somewhere in /var/log I'd guess
yes, /var/log/syslog iirc
syslog doesn't even mention the 4th sata hdd, I'm guessing it's a BIOS thing and it's not in dmesg either
ok. presumably you have had it recognised by some other operating system
and it's not a loose power cable or something
no actually not really
it's spinning but BIOS doesn't see it so either mobo problem or doa hdd
well check the data cable, both ends
will do (and maybe mobo has some SATA optino I need to enable, like losha said)
well sadly, BIOS option sata is enabled and I data cable is all right so this means try another data cable .. and if that doesn't work, try the hdd in another machine ?
guess so
...actually do something, you say.... my worse fears realized... thx for your help
np
